entry.title: Mikhail Gorbachev, the First and Last President of the U.S.S.R., Laid to Rest
entry.content: Former Soviet President Mikhail Gorbachev was laid to rest Saturday in a subdued farewell, with hundreds of mourners from former Soviet republics travelling to pay their respects.

entry.title: Ukraine Sees Many Ways to Hurt Russia in Kherson Offensive
entry.content: Success for Ukraine’s southern thrust could take many shapes, say officials and Western analysts. Kyiv can achieve progress by forcing Russia to expose its positions, take a defensive posture or pull troops from other parts of the country.

entry.title: Chileans Wary as They Vote for New Constitution That Would Upend Free Market Model
entry.content: Many worry that the new charter up for a vote Sunday would end legal equality, threaten property rights and expand the state’s role.
